thesis.description: The purpose of this investigation was to determine the distribution of the local heat transfer coefficients on the surface of longitudinal fins, and to investigate the effect of the geometry of the fin array on the distribution. An experimental investigation was carried out, and heat transfer coefficients were determined at nine positions on the surface of a longitudinal fin. [...]
thesis.creator: Thorlakson, John Ewart.
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: Local heat transfer coefficients on longitudinal finned surfaces.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Shock is a ubiquitous term. It is a term commonly heard in both scientific and non-scientific environments. It is a term so commonly used that it's meaning has become clouded. A perusal of scientific literature reveals a varied interpretation. This variety of opinion has led many to refrain from using the term, and some to suggest is abandonment. [...]
thesis.creator: Thompson, B. Gordon.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: Oxygen consumption, oxygen debt and cardiac output in experimental hemorrhagic shock in dogs.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The study of the pathogenesis and localization of vestibular and related pathology is in its developmental stage now. Some fascinating and outstanding work has been done in the last few years which has been of great help in clinical otoneurology. However, very few of the problems appear to be clear. As in any other developing branch of medicine, here too, there is a fair amount of controversy and divergent opinions. [...]
thesis.creator: Tarantino, Leopold.
thesis.subject: Otolaryngology.
thesis.title: Investigation on spontaneous and positional nystagmus: an electronystagmographic study.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The presence in a plant of factors which are capable of inducing estrus in animals was first reported by Loewe et al. (1927) in 1926. This fact, however, did not attract much attention until during World War II, when sheep in Australia, grazing on pastures of subterranean clover (Trifolium subterraneum), showed severe breeding disorders (Bennetts et al., 1946). [...]
thesis.creator: Tang, Gregory Wing Chan.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Chemistry.
thesis.title: Synthesis of C14-labelled isoflavones.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The aim of this thesis is (a) to analyse five years of published climatological data in order to obtain detailed climatological statistics for reasearch workers, and also to serve as a basis for describing the climate of Barbados. This is the main part of the thesis. (b) to give explanatory causes of the variations in climate, both seasonal and aperiodic, especially of temperature and rainfall regimes, at Waterford in particular, and the whole island in general. [...]
thesis.creator: Tandoh, Samuel Edwin.
thesis.subject: Meteorology.
thesis.title: The Climate of Barbados.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Geologists have drawn many conclusions from qualitative and quantitative geological studies in regard to past climatic conditions on the earth. Criteria formulated to determine ancient temperatures, or "paleotemperatures", can be divided into geological, mineralogical and ecological criteria. For example, tillites and pellodites are generally considered as being geological evidence of glacial conditions. [...]
thesis.creator: Tan, F. C.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Paleotemperature studies on Ordovician rocks.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Mount Pleasant in southwestern New Brunswick, the site of an ancient volcano in Mississippian time, is the location of a tin deposit containtng minor amounts of zinc, copper, lead, molybdenum, tungsten, and indium. The country rocks, a gently dipping, highly altered sequence of acidic volcanic rocks, termed feldspar and quartz porphyry, are cut by numerous steeply dipping structures includlng acidic intrusive dikes, breccia dikes and pipes, faults, shears and joints. [...]
thesis.creator: Tait, Sandra Elizabeth.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Breccias of the Mount Pleasant tin deposit, New Brunswick.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This report presents simplified theoretical models, based on Newtonian flow concepts, for the prediction of the injectant path, and hence the penetration distance for both gaseous (compressible) and liquid (incompressible secondary injection into a supersonic stream. [...]
thesis.creator: Szpiro, Eduard Jacob.
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: Secondary fluid injection into a supersonic airstream.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The sim of the experimental study here reported is to evaluate a foreign language teaching method which is based upon visual display of the printed word simultaneously with its pronunciation. The specific application is to the teaching of French at the Grade Five level in an elementary school of the Montreal system, where French language instruction begins at the third grade. [...]
thesis.creator: Sylvester, Gordon Frank.
thesis.subject: Education.
Visual aids.
French language -- Study and teaching (Elementary).
thesis.title: Simultaneous visual display and linguistic word groups in teaching elementary French.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The respiratory dead space may be defined as the space within the oro- nasal cavity, pharynx, larynx and tracheo-bronchial tree which does not participate in gas exchange. Even though the dead space is considered as not participating in respiratory gas exchange, it is important in that it serves as a functional buffer to protect against any unphysiological effects resulting from sudden changes in the nature of the gas breathed. [...]
thesis.creator: Sugiyama, Reiko.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Standard spontaneous ventilation in children under anaesthesia.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis examines French policies and attitudes towards the problems of national defence in the nuclear age. Its purpose is to explain certain policy outputs in terms of reactions to an environment or milieu. [...]
thesis.creator: Stevenson, Ian Garth.
thesis.subject: France -- Foreign policy.
France -- Army, Navy, and Defences.
France -- Military Policy.
Economics & Political Science.
Atomic bomb.
thesis.title: France and the atomic weapon.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

degree.name: Master of Arts
degree.discipline: Department of Economics and Political Science

thesis.description: A physiological distinction between the sensory transmission and integration of attended from non-attended stimuli is still awaited. We do not know "...what happens in the brain when the attention is directed one way or another..." In fact, neurophysiologists are still trying to establish the more basic distinction between sensory transmission and integration in wakefulness as opposed to sleep. [...]
thesis.creator: Steinberg, Roy Herbert.
thesis.subject: Neurology & Neurosurgery.
thesis.title: Effects of adaptation, arousal, and repetitive stimulation upon photic responses of the primary visual pathway in the cat.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: During the month the zonal harmonics are well behaved and the increasing variance in the symmetric component (0, 2) reflects the seasonal strengthening of the westerlies in the northern hemisphere. In the wave regime the eccentric components with m = 1 appear to be global entities but the continuity is less obvious as one goes to higher orders. The wave subset with m = 4 exhibits an oscillation in parity such as one would expect from independent systems in the two hemispheres moving with different angular velocities. [...]
thesis.creator: Steinberg, Hyman Leonard.
thesis.subject: Atmosphere.
Meteorology -- Observations.
Meteorology.
thesis.title: A spherical harmonic specification of the global 500 mb surface.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: With the rapid increase in human population during recent years, a growing interest has developed in the resources of the sea. Although much basic knowledge has accumulated concerning the life in temperate and boreal waters, particularly of the eastern Atlantic, less is known of the fauna and flora of the arctic and subarctic (Dunbar 1953). More information is needed on the standing crops and production rates of the important members of marine ecosystems in the low temperatures of high latitudes, so that production can be evaluated. [...]
thesis.creator: Steele, V.
thesis.subject: Zoology.
Marine animals -- Arctic regions.
Amphipoda -- Arctic regions.
thesis.title: Reproduction and metabolism in Gammurus oceanicus Segerstrale and Gammarus setosus Dementieva.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Electron tunneling between superconductors is a technique which has been used to study the electronic structure of the superconducting state and to verify the Bardeen-Cooper-Schrieffer theory of superconductivity. The usual experimental situation consists of two evaporated metal films separated by a thin (approximately 20 A) insulating layer of metal oxide, such as Al203. [...]
thesis.creator: Stavn, Melvin Jared.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: The Josephson current by the spin - analog method.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Electron spin echoes observed as a function of time using both the two pulse sequence and the three pulse stimulated echo sequence exhibit a complicated modulation of the echo envelope. This has been attributed to the neighbouring magnetic nuclei surrounding the paramagnetic ion. [...]
thesis.creator: Srivastava, Vishnu Chandra.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Transient nuclear effects in electron spin echo phenomena.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The present work is concerned with the educational system of the Swabian minority in Hungary. It wishes to indicate the expedient methods used by the Hungarian regimes to bring about the Magyarisation of the German minority. At the same time, it also wishes to demonstrate the existence of an ambiguous relationship between the Swabian minority school policy in Hungary and Hungarian-German relations, set against the background of opportunistic Hungarian diplomacy, which manifested itself both internally and externally. [...]
thesis.creator: Spira, Thomas.
thesis.subject: Hungary -- Foreign relations -- Germany.
Hungary -- Education.
Germans in Hungary.
History.
thesis.title: The German minority school problem in Hungary, 1918-1938.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The desire to obtain a perfect physical environment and a more satisfying way of life is typical of Western Civilization, since it possesses dynamic force and incorporates economic strife for progress. The Central Area of a city is generally considered as the focal point of both communal and commercial life. It is in this Central Area where the greatest concentration of human activities from all parts of the Metropolis exist. [...]
thesis.creator: Ng, Spencer Che Lou.
thesis.subject: Architecture.
City planning -- Québec (Province) -- Montréal.
thesis.title: The development of complex commercial projects in central areas with special reference to Montreal.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Meteorologists working in numerical weather prediction are faced with two distinct types of problems. The first problem is to devise a mathematical model which will represent the significant physical processes that occur in the atmosphere. The second problem is to integrate the model equations by applying numerical techniques over a grid network ot discrete points. [...]
thesis.creator: Soucy, Joseph René Danny.
thesis.subject: Meteorology.
Weather forecasting.
thesis.title: Finite difference Jacobians in numerical weather prediction.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Glycosides, oligosaccharides, and especially polysaccharides are widespread in nature and occur in bacteria, algae, land plants and animals. One of their most important characteristics is their ability to hydrolyze under the influence of acids, and this fact makes it relatively easy to determine their overall chemical composition, as well as their detailed structure. On the other hand, it is often desirable to avoid hydrolytic depolymerization of polysaccharides, either for practical or for theoretical reasons. [...]
thesis.creator: Soltes, Edward John.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Attempted synthesis of pseudoaldobiuronic acids.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The classification of gliomas has always presented difficulties due to the wide range of variations found even among the gliomas of the same type, thus making it necessary to create subgroupings of complex diversity. This has been done by several authors from the time the classification progressed from a physical to a histogenetic basis and it became necessary for investigators to create complex subgroupings. [...]
thesis.creator: Solis-Quiroga, Orlando H.
thesis.subject: Neurology & Neurosurgery.
thesis.title: Analytical survey of one hundred and twelve cases of "unclassified glioma".
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A neurohumoral transmitter is a substance which not only is released when a nerve is stimulated but which also is capable of exhibiting effects like those of nervous stimulation. There is no reason to doubt that such substances play an important part in transmitting impulses from the nerve to its effector organ (1). [...]
thesis.creator: Smoly, Jennie Mary.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: The biosynthesis of acetylcarnityl CoA by various tissue preparations.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A new analogue random signal correlator for measuring auto and the cross-correlation coefficient has been designed using sensistors. The design required the development of new: a) A.-c. power amplifiers b) Square law device c) D. C. sum and difference amplifiers e) A normalizing divider circuit. The instrument was tested by measuring the cross-correlation coefficient in a reverberant room of known characteristics. It was found that the instrument has an accuracy of better than 2 percent.
thesis.creator: Smith, Leo Camille.
thesis.subject: Electrical Engineering.
thesis.title: A random signal correlator.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Almost a decade ago, Breuer and Pavan (1955) reported for the first time that during larval growth DNA synthesis proceeds disproportionately along polytene chromosomes of Rhynochosciara (R. angelae). In such chromosomes, treated by Feulgen reaction, the intensity of stain appeared heavier at the points where the bulbs were formed, thus indicating localized accumulation of DNA molecules. [...]
thesis.creator: Sinha, Anil K.
thesis.subject: Genetics.
Genetics.
DNA.
Chromosome replication.
thesis.title: Temporal and morphologic sequence of DNA replication in the mammalian chromosome complements.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In the last few years few reports on the incidence of yeasts from natural sources have been published, and only a few of these investigations concerned more than one source of isolation. Most investigations on microflora of various habitats were directed towards the number rather than the types of bacteria, yeasts and fungi. Studies on wild yeasts were directed toward their fermentative capabilities and the identification of these yeasts was neglected. [...]
thesis.creator: Simard, Ronald E.
thesis.subject: Yeast -- Physiology.
Microbiology.
thesis.title: Characteristics of yeasts isolated from various ecological sources.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
